sentences.en: ...a wood carving of a human hand.
"What a marvelous carving!" the starving harvester in vest said.
sentences.cn: “好一件神奇的雕刻！”挨饿的穿着背心的收割者说。

sentences.en: All the furniture in the room had much carving.
sentences.cn: 房间里所有的家具上都有许多雕刻.

sentences.en: At the very bottom of the chest were his carving tools.
sentences.cn: 箱子最底下是他的雕刻工具。

sentences.en: He acquired the craft of wood carving in his native town.
sentences.cn: 他在老家学会了木雕手艺.

sentences.en: He has set about carving up the company which Hammer created from almost nothing.
sentences.cn: 他已经开始动手拆分这家几乎是哈默白手起家创办的公司。

sentences.en: He sharpened his knife in preparation for carving the meat.
I found wood carving satisfying and painting fun.
sentences.cn: 我发觉刻木雕过瘾，画油画好玩。
我觉得木雕能给人带来满足感。

sentences.en: I picked up a piece of wood and started carving.
sentences.cn: 我拿起一块木头，开始雕刻起来。

sentences.en: Spear a piece of fish with a carving fork and dip it in the batter.
sentences.cn: 用切肉叉叉一片鱼肉，在面糊里蘸一下。

sentences.en: The best carving utensil is a long, sharp, flexible knife.
sentences.cn: 最好的雕刻工具是锋利而柔韧的长刻刀。

sentences.en: We  suppose that  you're carving gargoyle up in the corner of this building .
sentences.cn: 我们假设你在雕刻建筑高处的某一角上的滴水嘴怪。

sentences.en: Wood has not had much luck in carving out a career.
sentences.cn: 伍德想干出点名堂来，可是总不能如愿。

sentences.en: Worn blackened window - ledges catch the eye , whose delicate carving can scarcely distinguished.
sentences.cn: 有些地方,露出破旧黝黑的窗槛, 细巧的雕刻已经看不大清.

sentences.en: You cannot date the carving and it is difficult to date the stone itself.
sentences.cn: 无法确定这一雕刻的年代，连石头本身的年代都难以判断。

words.tran_cn: 切肉刀；雕刻者；切肉的人
雕刻（carve的过去式和过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 切肉用的餐刀，切肉刀；雕刻刀

trans.tran_en: an object or pattern made by cutting a shape in wood or stone for decoration

trans.tran_cn: 雕刻，切下（ carve的现在分词）
